Title: Nurture
Content: Nurture is usually defined as the process of caring for an organism as it grows usually a human It is often used in debates as the opposite of nature whereby nurture means the process of replicating learned cultural information from one mind to another and nature means the replication of genetic nonlearned behavior Nurture is important in the nature versus nurture debate as some people see either nature or nurture as the final outcome of the origins of most of humanitys behaviours There are many agents of socialization that are responsible in some respects the outcome of a childs personality behaviour thoughts social and emotional skills feelings and mental priorities
